description: A first course in statistical methods for scientists, this course addresses issues for
proposing/designing an experiment, as well as exploratory and inferential techniques for analyzing
and modeling scientific data. Topics include probability models, exploratory graphics, descriptive
techniques, statistical designs, hypothesis testing, confidence intervals, Bayesian inference,
simple/multiple regression, and methods for censored data.  Prerequisite: Mathematics 120, 121, or
equivalent, and an introductory science course.
